page.title: 18POPULATION
page.content: The gentle contours of the South Downs leading down to the English Channel attracted businessman Charles Neville to think of a garden city by the sea. By 1921 the first house was ready for occupation.Many more were in the course of erection and most of the area near the clifftop had been divide into more plots for sale,each 25feet wide and 100 feet deep. By 1924 Neville's estate company had helped three thousand people to complete their homes in Peacehaven,whose names had been chosen in a newspaper competition with building plots as prizes. Not all the winners had houses built and plots where no building was done still remain empty today.
